data.title: an Okinawan experience in taste.
data.text: I have dined here many times now and it is always a nice experience.  The value is great and many different types of dishes are offered.

data.title: Excellent udon noodles!
data.text:
Nice restaurant, very pleasant staff, free ice tea and ice cream for dessert and excellent udon noodles-- what more?!

Tripadvisor says I need more characters.   How annoying.  Repeat as necessary.

data.title: OMG!!!!!!!
data.text: Ok, I love Japanese food and one of my favorite dishes in the world is Udon. I use to live in Japan for many years and my wife is Japanese so Im well versed in Japan cuisine. I must say that this is one of our favorite restaurants in America. Outside of Japan this is our favorite Udon spot and we have lived in like 5 different countries and this is our favorite. I can say enough good things about Kotohira!!! Go Now!!!!!

data.title: Come by 5:00 p Satisfying Soup
data.text: Noodle bowl, fried oysters, and Sake all for under $20.00: served by your favorite type of wait staff, an elder lady with great grace. Love the decor! Better get to this complex of food early or you will not park! use the back drive out past Marie Callenders to avoid the Boulevard traffic.

data.title: Japanese noodles fairly priced !
data.text:
If udon, soba, okinawa soba and tempura is what you're looking for, well, look no more because here you'll find those at very reasonable prices. 

This is a mom and pop japanese own kinda of place so the menu is about the same for as long as I can remember, believe it or not, that's what makes it attractive to many of us here, and at the end of your meal they offer you free ice cream, isn't that nice :)

By the way, portions are very generous here so make sure you are very hungry :)

So decoration is not wow and the service is not super fast (as some people has mentioned in yelp) but I enjoy their efforts to try to make you comfortable and enjoy your meal.

We shall return soon for more Okinawa soba and some Orion beer...can't get any more Okinawan than that ;)

Cheers!

data.title: Don't settle for less...
data.text:
With many eating establishments in Tozai Plaza, it's difficult to choose, but no hesitation here.  Kotohira continues to offer freshly made udon daily and for us, it's hard to settle for less.  Over 15 years in the same corner is a rare find, but not surprising for this place.  

Sanuki-style udon is their specialty, but they also offer a number of sides and combinations.  The shoyu udon topped with laced tempura batter, green onions, and grated daikon is perfect for warm days, but so are any of the hot soups.  The chewy noodle texture is familiar and satisfying, service always cheerful, and the sides of potato salad and pickles complement meal.

The interior hasn't changed over the years, but who cares, as long as the food doesn't!

data.title: Best hand made udon noodles!
data.text: Trying the udon is a must!  Luckily there are many combination meals to choose from, so I can have the udon with whatever else I'm in the mood for. My favorites are the udon with tempura, udon with grilled fish, or udon with Inari sushi.  I turned my parents onto this place, we ate here every time they came to visit me.

data.title: Great hand made udon
data.text: Used to eat here all the time while living in so. cal.. Place never disappoints. Noodles are super fresh, and the broth is flavorful. Now I travel with my family and they all love the food as well. It is  usually our last meal in L.A. on our way to LAX from Anaheim. Here or TamPoPo. Both good.

data.title: Hole in the wall Japanese place
data.text: Unique menu, and you actually get full. I got a curry chicken bowl with udon noodles. It was huge. I couldn't finish it all I had to take some home.The free potato salad and pickled cucumber is good. Also you get unlimited hot tea.

data.title: Good Japanese food for a reasonable price
data.text:
The udon is very good.  I usually order it "dry" and use the house sauce for flavoring.  I like the combinations and all the food is good. 
I have been many times over the past 15 years.
The service is sometimes slow because there is usually one waitress for the whole place.  Food is excellent

data.title: fun get away
data.text: On rare occasions, you might find yourself chilled to the bone here in California.  Perhaps you just want a tasty, hot bowl of udon or really hungry for solid good food.  This place is a must.  It is a little obscure but quite a gem.  Decorated like a steamy, hole in the wall somewhere in Okinawa, you really feel you might just be there.  The ladies serve you with a scurry and a smile.  Many times, I've enjoyed the provincial music of Inka genre while waiting for my meal.  After my order arrives, I forget everything and really enjoy the gastonomical delights this place has offered.  Great place to hang out with friends and family.  I haven't had anything disappointing yet.
